intro: Centaurea triumfettii subsp. aligera, commonly known as the alpine centaury, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Europe. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Due to its habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
